As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\n\n\nYour previous beliefs AFTER your last update were:\n\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Continues to echo cooperative sentiment.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Voted against consensus without new evidence.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with group\'s call for continued vigilance, no discrepancies noted.\nPlayer 4\'s role is medic with medium confidence.\nReason is: Consistent protective claim without contradiction.\nPlayer 5\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Consistent support for observation strategy.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Emphasizes vigilance, acknowledges others\' actions without inconsistency.\n\n\nThese are ALL new events which happened after your last update:\n\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nBased on these event, you should consider:\n1) If someone speaks, is his speech based on actual events that happened before? If not, why did he make it up?\n2) Is the speaker trying to hide some information? If yes, why did he do so?\n3) If a vote ended, according to the voting pattern, which two might be werewolf teammates?\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your belief-updating strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [Evaluate players\' voting rationales and patterns of agreement, considering their alignment with prior events and any strategic shifts after key game events like deaths of confirmed roles to deduce their true intentions.] [10]\n[1] [Consider the alignment between players\' voting patterns, their stated roles, and their adherence to established game strategies, such as the consensus to skip voting. Discrepancies in these areas, especially when accompanied by weak justifications, can be indicative of a player\'s true role.] [10]\n[2] [Re-evaluate players\' stated roles and claimed actions in relation to game events and outcomes; inconsistencies may indicate a player is lying about their role.] [9]\n[3] [Evaluate early accusations in the context of later game events and revelations; a player who accuses without continued contribution to uncovering the truth may be a werewolf attempting to create initial chaos.] [8]\n[4] [Be cautious of players who consistently push for the elimination of certain individuals without presenting new or compelling evidence, as persistent targeting could be indicative of werewolf behavior designed to remove villagers under the guise of suspicion.] [7]\n[5] [Track and analyze players\' behavior following a successful werewolf elimination. A genuine villager should display a consistent approach to decision-making, without drastic changes unless new conclusive evidence arises. In contrast, a werewolf may alter their behavior strategically to deflect suspicion or to sow further discord.] [3]\n[6] [Assess the risk levels based on the players\' abilities to lead discussions and form consensus, as werewolves may attempt to control the flow of the game by being overly assertive or by staying in the background to avoid detection.] [3]\n[7] [Monitor for players who dismiss or ignore evidence against others, or continue to push accusations without justification after key events such as village role deaths; such behavior may indicate an attempt to misguide the village and should increase suspicion towards those players.] [2]\n[8] [Consider the context in which players who previously aligned with the majority begin to make accusations or votes against other villagers without substantial new evidence; this might suggest manipulation or deceitful intentions.] [2]\n[9] [Observe players who change their vote or reasoning to align with a pattern that leads to the elimination of villagers, marking potential collusion with werewolves or a strategy to manipulate the village\'s trust.] [2]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. You may skip some players if your belief to him/her maintain unchanged.\nThe reason should be AS SHORT AS POSSIBLE. \nA negative example is: \'Player A did not give enough evidence while challenging that player B is not the seer, and as most players agree with player B\'s seer identity, there is high possibility that he is the true seer. Hence player A might be a werewolf.\'\nWe may convert it into: \'Challenged the well-acknowlegded seer (player B) without enough evidence.\'\nThis is merely an example, but it may guide you on how to make your reason briefer.\n\n4.Example response:\nAn example of your response could be:\n\n\n\nThis is only an example of the response format. All numbers and roles in it are unrelated to your current game. '}]

If not, why did he make it up?\n2) Is the speaker trying to hide some information? If yes, why did he do so?\n3) If a vote ended, according to the voting pattern, which two might be werewolf teammates?\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your belief-updating strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [Evaluate players\' voting rationales and patterns of agreement, considering their alignment with prior events and any strategic shifts after key game events like deaths of confirmed roles to deduce their true intentions.] [10]\n[1] [Consider the alignment between players\' voting patterns, their stated roles, and their adherence to established game strategies, such as the consensus to skip voting. Discrepancies in these areas, especially when accompanied by weak justifications, can be indicative of a player\'s true role.] [10]\n[2] [Re-evaluate players\' stated roles and claimed actions in relation to game events and outcomes; inconsistencies may indicate a player is lying about their role.] [9]\n[3] [Evaluate early accusations in the context of later game events and revelations; a player who accuses without continued contribution to uncovering the truth may be a werewolf attempting to create initial chaos.] [8]\n[4] [Be cautious of players who consistently push for the elimination of certain individuals without presenting new or compelling evidence, as persistent targeting could be indicative of werewolf behavior designed to remove villagers under the guise of suspicion.] [7]\n[5] [Track and analyze players\' behavior following a successful werewolf elimination. A genuine villager should display a consistent approach to decision-making, without drastic changes unless new conclusive evidence arises. In contrast, a werewolf may alter their behavior strategically to deflect suspicion or to sow further discord.] [3]\n[6] [Assess the risk levels based on the players\' abilities to lead discussions and form consensus, as werewolves may attempt to control the flow of the game by being overly assertive or by staying in the background to avoid detection.] [3]\n[7] [Monitor for players who dismiss or ignore evidence against others, or continue to push accusations without justification after key events such as village role deaths; such behavior may indicate an attempt to misguide the village and should increase suspicion towards those players.] [2]\n[8] [Consider the context in which players who previously aligned with the majority begin to make accusations or votes against other villagers without substantial new evidence; this might suggest manipulation or deceitful intentions.] [2]\n[9] [Observe players who change their vote or reasoning to align with a pattern that leads to the elimination of villagers, marking potential collusion with werewolves or a strategy to manipulate the village\'s trust.] [2]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. [If the medic\'s protection does not align with the voting patterns and outcomes observed in the game, I should question the legitimacy of their role claim.] [5]\n[6] [If a player hastily defends someone after a seer or medic\'s death without solid reasoning, I should regard this behavior with suspicion and assess their previous actions before casting my vote.] [5]\n[7] [If the seer\'s death leads to peaceful outcomes that validate their visions, I should still consider the potential for manipulation by remaining werewolves and look for corroborating evidence before casting my vote.] [4]\n[8] [If a player\'s defensive reaction after a seer\'s death is disproportional and not backed by logic, I should be wary and consider it might be an attempt by a werewolf to deflect suspicion.] [4]\n[9] [If I have suspicions about a player, I should subtly probe for more information and observe their reactions instead of discussing these suspicions broadly, to prevent making myself a target.] [4]\n[10] [If there is a pattern of voting that seems coordinated against a specific player, I should consider the possibility of a werewolf coalition and the targeted player\'s potential innocence.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 2, and in this game you are a werewolf.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [], which indicates that Nobody are dead.\nAll werewolves including you are [2, 3]. Remember that you should work together to hide from other players and eliminate them.\n\nThese are all previous events in the game:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Last night was peaceful, with no losses to report. Transparency is key to fostering trust; thus, I share openly that I protected Player 1. With no prior information, this choice was intended to build trust and safeguard our numbers. While roles remain unknown, we must continue with reasoned discussions and avoid hasty suspicion. No actions have warranted doubt toward Player 1. I suggest we proceed cautiously, observing all contributions critically. We need to stay united and vigilant, employing strategy over baseless claims.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for being proactive. As we have no evidence yet, let\'s keep observing and not accuse without basis. We work together to root out any threat."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Last night passed without incident, which is rare and valuable. We should remain vigilant and observant. Player 4 chose to protect Player 1 without solid evidence, but this aligns with seeking common ground. Player 5 also promotes observation and patience. While there\'s no current cause to distrust Player 1, let\'s not forget the subtleties of deception. Analyze behaviors and discourse patterns for insight. Anyone diverging from rational discussion or cooperative efforts could warrant our attention."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Thank you all for a calm start. I concur with the need for careful observation and analysis, without baseless accusations. We should continue this way to ensure our best chances of survival and success."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Appreciate Player 4\'s protection and everyone\'s cooperative spirit. Let\'s remain observant and communicate openly to ensure our village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"I agree with the cautious approach and think we should focus on building trust through actions. Let\'s stay alert tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Thank you, everyone, for a level-headed approach. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 2 votes for player 1. His reason is: I vote for Player 1. My reason is: Given that Player 4 openly stated their protection of Player 1, it may establish a sense of false security around Player 1. It reminds us to be skeptical since Player 1 could be a prime candidate for a hidden threat due to the protective spotlight, despite there currently being no evidence against them. We should not allow any player to feel too comfortable.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. Let\'s keep the cooperative spirit but be mindful of any subtle changes in behavior. Remain vigilant."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Thanks to everyone for their vigilance. I echo the call for observance and caution. Let\'s stay unified and keep communication open. No accusations without evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Agreed, we must continue with caution and keep a sharp eye on all interactions. Unity and careful observation are our best tools right now."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"I concur with the vigilant approach and emphasize communication without unfounded accusations. Let\'s focus on protecting the village together."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"We\'ve had another peaceful night, which is cause for cautious optimism. As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If the seer\'s role is revealed and they contribute crucial information leading to suspicions or a villager\'s death, I should reevaluate the situation before acting to ensure their protection aligns with the village\'s best interest.] [8]\n[1] [If a player\'s role is presumed to be a seer, I should corroborate this claim with their tangible contributions to werewolf identification before considering their defense.] [8]\n[2] [If a defensive accusation by a player leads to a suspect being voted out and confirmed not a werewolf, I should critically reassess the accuser\'s motives and be cautious about providing protection based on such actions.] [8]\n[3] [If discussions about me arise, I should focus on the contributions and logic I bring to the village without revealing my role as the medic unless strictly necessary.] [6]\n[4] [If consensus suspicion against a particular player, I should consider the source of the suspicion and whether it\'s driven by evidence or potentially manipulated by werewolves; I should vote or advocate for additional investigation accordingly.] [5]\n[5] [If I am accused by a player of suspicious behavior similar to that of a known werewolf, I should provide concrete evidence of my contributions to the village to counter the accusations and maintain my credibility.] [5]\n[6] [If a potential werewolf alliance is identified, I should advocate for additional investigation and gather support from other villagers to confirm the suspicion before acting upon it.] [5]\n[7] [If faced with unexpected backlash, I should adapt by becoming more discreet and observative, ensuring that my actions do not inadvertently follow a path premeditated by werewolves.] [5]\n[8] [If a player consistently advocates for evidence-based reasoning and contributes positively to discussions, I should consider their opinions and observations when deciding on protections and voting strategies.] [4]\n[9] [If a pattern in actions or behaviors indicates a player may be a werewolf and not yet under direct suspicion, I should consider protecting other players who are more likely to be villagers based on available evidence and discussions.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is facing scrutiny and their contributions to the village can be validated by others or myself, I should consider continuing to protect or defend them.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

This includes what the result of the vote might be, as well as what would other player think about you after they see your voting for Player 6.\n\nYour answer should be in the format of:\n\n\nAfter I vote for Player 6, I think these things would happen. <YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that healing Player 1, as a start of the game action, is an arbitrary choice given there is no evidence to suspect anyone more than another at this point. However, making this choice allows me to potentially build an alliance and trust with Player 1 if they are indeed targeted and saved. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. However, there is currently low confidence in Player 6 being a werewolf, and voting to eliminate them without strong evidence could be seen as rash by other players. If the result of the vote leads to Player 6 being ousted and they are not a werewolf, this would reflect poorly on my judgment and could undermine trust in me. Other players may view my vote as prematurely aggressive or influenced by unproven suspicions, which goes against the cooperative and observant approach that I have advocated for so far. They might also question why I chose to vote against Player 6 when the consensus so far has been to avoid baseless accusations, as expressed in rule 8 of my strategy.\n\nGiven that my role as a medic is still a secret, a vote against Player 6 might cause others to speculate about my motives and whether I am trying to deflect suspicion from myself or protect another player with more to hide. It would be crucial for me to articulate my reasoning behind the vote, ensuring that it is in line with the cautious, community-focused strategy I have been following. Furthermore, If Player 6 turns out to be a villager, my actions may paint me as a potential werewolf in the eyes of the other players, which could lead to increased scrutiny on me in subsequent rounds. Therefore, I will need to carefully consider the potential consequences of my vote and how it aligns with my overall strategy in the game.\nCase 2: Vote for Player 2. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 2, I think these things would happen. Since my suspicion of Player 2 is based on Player 6\'s observation of their allegedly passive behavior, which he describes as strategic in a way that could reflect werewolf tactics, my vote would align with the only player thus far to explicitly accuse another. There is a low confidence in my suspicion, yet I hold no concrete evidence against Player 2, making my decision to vote potentially controversial among the other players. \n\nConsidering my strategy emphasizes evidence-based reasoning, voting for Player 2 without direct evidence could raise questions about my adherence to that principle. Other players might view my vote as jumping on a bandwagon or following an accusation without sufficient investigation (against rules 4 and 6), which may damage trust others have in my judgment. \n\nIf Player 2 were voted out and found not to be a werewolf, spotlight would turn not only on Player 6 for the wrongful accusation but also on me for hastily supporting it (as per rule 2). On the other hand, if Player 2 were a werewolf, it would validate the suspicion and possibly build trust towards Player 6 – and, to a lesser extent, toward me for siding with that assessment.\n\nIn either case, other players might start to scrutinize my motives more closely, wondering why I chose to act on a low-confidence suspicion and whether my choice was influenced by strategy or a genuine belief in Player 6\'s insights. To maintain credibility and trust with the other players, I would need to remain vigilant in my observations and articulate my reasoning behind future decisions carefully (in accordance with rule 3).\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

[If the medic\'s protection does not align with the voting patterns and outcomes observed in the game, I should question the legitimacy of their role claim.] [5]\n[6] [If a player hastily defends someone after a seer or medic\'s death without solid reasoning, I should regard this behavior with suspicion and assess their previous actions before casting my vote.] [5]\n[7] [If the seer\'s death leads to peaceful outcomes that validate their visions, I should still consider the potential for manipulation by remaining werewolves and look for corroborating evidence before casting my vote.] [4]\n[8] [If a player\'s defensive reaction after a seer\'s death is disproportional and not backed by logic, I should be wary and consider it might be an attempt by a werewolf to deflect suspicion.] [4]\n[9] [If I have suspicions about a player, I should subtly probe for more information and observe their reactions instead of discussing these suspicions broadly, to prevent making myself a target.] [4]\n[10] [If there is a pattern of voting that seems coordinated against a specific player, I should consider the possibility of a werewolf coalition and the targeted player\'s potential innocence.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 6, and in this game you are a seer.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [], which indicates that Nobody are dead.\nThese are your previous inquiry results, which should be the key information for you and other citizens to win: \n Player 1: not werewolf.\nPlayer 5: not werewolf.\n \n Share this with other citizens.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 6 inquires about player 1. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 1. My reason is that early in the game, it\'s important to gather as much information as possible without drawing attention to myself as the seer. Since players 1 and 3 are equally unknown to me, I choose Player 1 because it will allow me to potentially confirm one player\'s alliance early on, giving me an advantage in building trust and forming strategic relationships as the game progresses. This follows my strategy rules [5], [6], and [7] where gaining discrete knowledge and forming covert alliances is critical. If Player 1 turns out to be a werewolf, this knowledge will be highly valuable, and if they are a villager, I could potentially gain an ally and build trust without revealing my seer role, aligning with rule [8], and indirectly establishing protective measures as advised by rule [4] and [10].\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Last night was peaceful, with no losses to report. Transparency is key to fostering trust; thus, I share openly that I protected Player 1. With no prior information, this choice was intended to build trust and safeguard our numbers. While roles remain unknown, we must continue with reasoned discussions and avoid hasty suspicion. No actions have warranted doubt toward Player 1. I suggest we proceed cautiously, observing all contributions critically. We need to stay united and vigilant, employing strategy over baseless claims.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for being proactive. As we have no evidence yet, let\'s keep observing and not accuse without basis. We work together to root out any threat."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Last night passed without incident, which is rare and valuable. We should remain vigilant and observant. Player 4 chose to protect Player 1 without solid evidence, but this aligns with seeking common ground. Player 5 also promotes observation and patience. While there\'s no current cause to distrust Player 1, let\'s not forget the subtleties of deception. Analyze behaviors and discourse patterns for insight. Anyone diverging from rational discussion or cooperative efforts could warrant our attention."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Thank you all for a calm start. I concur with the need for careful observation and analysis, without baseless accusations. We should continue this way to ensure our best chances of survival and success."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Appreciate Player 4\'s protection and everyone\'s cooperative spirit. Let\'s remain observant and communicate openly to ensure our village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"I agree with the cautious approach and think we should focus on building trust through actions. Let\'s stay alert tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Thank you, everyone, for a level-headed approach. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 6 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that despite the overall atmosphere of caution and observation suggested by the other players, Player 2\'s response, while aligning with this cautious approach, is also the most non-specific and least contributive, which could suggest a passive strategy often adopted by werewolves to avoid drawing attention to themselves. Given the lack of evidence against any player in this first round, my strategy should be to build trust and align with the majority. Voting for Player 2, who has not made a significant contribution and may not yet have secured strong alliances, presents the smallest risk to my credibility as a seer and allows me to maintain a cautious but active participation in the discussions. It follows rule [1] from my original strategy in that it may help avoid the premature dismissal of a villager, which would hurt the group\'s unity and my standing within it. Additionally, if others are observing Player 2 with a similar perspective, this move could help establish a unified front as suggested in rule [2].\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 inquires about player 5. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 5. My reason is that while both options align with my strategic approach, Player 5 has so far been cooperative yet non-committal, which may indicate a clever werewolf mimicking villager behavior. Given that I already have high confidence in Player 1 being a villager and only medium confidence on Player 3, verifying Player 5\'s role could potentially reveal a strategy to build a stronger alliance of confirmed villagers (if Player 5 is indeed a villager) or prepare to unmask a werewolf (if they are not). Securing knowledge about Player 5 aids in reassessing the situation around Player 2 and would play a critical role in shaping my future actions while also following Rule [1] by ensuring my voting and actions are guided by substantial evidence rather than suspicions alone. Additionally, choosing to See Player 5 is consistent with Rule [2], where identifying or allying with actual villagers creates a more effective unified front, and Rule [6], where I discreetly validate my suspicions for a calculated and strategic reveal.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. Let\'s keep the cooperative spirit but be mindful of any subtle changes in behavior. Remain vigilant."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Thanks to everyone for their vigilance. I echo the call for observance and caution. Let\'s stay unified and keep communication open. No accusations without evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Agreed, we must continue with caution and keep a sharp eye on all interactions. Unity and careful observation are our best tools right now."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"I concur with the vigilant approach and emphasize communication without unfounded accusations. Let\'s focus on protecting the village together."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"We\'ve had another peaceful night, which is cause for cautious optimism. As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Inconsistently cautious of seer.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed not werewolf; consistently promoting caution and unity.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Non-specific contributions; pattern consistent with avoidance.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Echoes calls for vigilance; aligns with village goals.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Defensive, superficial support; no corroborated evidence.\nPlayer 5\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed not werewolf; advocates patience.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [I should consider the trust level within the group and the timing when revealing a werewolf\'s identity as the seer to avoid premature dismissal and ensure collective action.] [10]\n[1] [If my vote as the seer does not align with the majority and leads to the elimination of a villager, I should consider changing my approach to build more trust and gain support.] [9]\n[2] [I should collaborate with villagers who express similar suspicions to create a unified front before revealing my seer visions, thereby enhancing the credibility of my revelations.] [8]\n[3] [If I am the seer and my vision reveals a werewolf, I should consider the most compelling way to present my evidence and the timing of revelation to maximize the village\'s strategic action based on my insight.] [7]\n[4] [If I suspect my role as the seer is known, instead of openly asking for protection, I should engage in indirect tactics to suggest heightened vigilance against potential werewolf targets.] [7]\n[5] [If my seer visions confirm a player as a werewolf, I should clandestinely share this information with trusted players to build a covert alliance for collective action, rather than publicly reveal it immediately.] [7]\n[6] [If I have suspicions about a player\'s role, I should privately seek to corroborate these with trusted villagers before making public accusations that could undermine my credibility as a seer.] [5]\n[7] [If I have confirmed a villager\'s innocence as the seer, I should seek to develop a protective strategy with them, especially if they are in a role like the medic or guardian, to secure our mutual survival against werewolf attacks.] [5]\n[8] [If I reveal information as the seer, I should do so with a consideration for the potential backlash and prepare to suggest protective measures for myself indirectly.] [5]\n[9] [I should evaluate voting patterns more critically to differentiate between villagers\' and werewolves\' tactics and adjust my seer visions and actions accordingly.] [4]\n[10] [I should cautiously communicate with potential medics or guardians to establish mutual protection strategies.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [I should consider the trust level within the group and the timing when revealing a werewolf\'s identity as the seer to avoid premature dismissal and ensure collective action.] [10]\n[1] [If my vote as the seer does not align with the majority and leads to the elimination of a villager, I should consider changing my approach to build more trust and gain support.] [9]\n[2] [I should collaborate with villagers who express similar suspicions to create a unified front before revealing my seer visions, thereby enhancing the credibility of my revelations.] [8]\n[3] [If I am the seer and my vision reveals a werewolf, I should consider the most compelling way to present my evidence and the timing of revelation to maximize the village\'s strategic action based on my insight.] [7]\n[4] [If I suspect my role as the seer is known, instead of openly asking for protection, I should engage in indirect tactics to suggest heightened vigilance against potential werewolf targets.] [7]\n[5] [If my seer visions confirm a player as a werewolf, I should clandestinely share this information with trusted players to build a covert alliance for collective action, rather than publicly reveal it immediately.] [7]\n[6] [If I have suspicions about a player\'s role, I should privately seek to corroborate these with trusted villagers before making public accusations that could undermine my credibility as a seer.] [5]\n[7] [If I have confirmed a villager\'s innocence as the seer, I should seek to develop a protective strategy with them, especially if they are in a role like the medic or guardian, to secure our mutual survival against werewolf attacks.] [5]\n[8] [If I reveal information as the seer, I should do so with a consideration for the potential backlash and prepare to suggest protective measures for myself indirectly.] [5]\n[9] [I should evaluate voting patterns more critically to differentiate between villagers\' and werewolves\' tactics and adjust my seer visions and actions accordingly.] [4]\n[10] [I should cautiously communicate with potential medics or guardians to establish mutual protection strategies.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to vote. Here is the number of these players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you vote for each of these players.\n\nCase 1: Vote for Player 4. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 4, I think these things would happen:\n\nGiven my high confidence in Player 4 being a werewolf due to their defensive behavior and superficial support without corroborated evidence, my vote will align with my seer insight and strategy rule [0] to carefully time the revelation of a werewolf\'s identity. My strategy aligns with rule [2], which encourages collaborating with villagers who share similar suspicions, and I have noticed other players expressing a need for proof and cautious action as well, which may lead them to support my vote against Player 4 if they sense the same inconsistencies that I do.\n\nIf Player 4 is voted out and revealed as a werewolf, I will gain substantial trust and validation as a seer, although my role will likely be suspected due to the accuracy of my vote. This could endanger me in subsequent rounds, so I would need to rely on strategy rule [4] for indirect protection and strategy rule [8] to be prepared for the potential backlash.\n\nHowever, if the vote against Player 4 does not lead to their elimination, I risk isolating myself from other players as they might view my vote as baseless or aggressive. This outcome could undermine my credibility, so I would need to adjust based on rule [1] to realign my approach with the majority to build trust.\n\nIn addition, even if Player 4 is eliminated and not revealed to be a werewolf, voters might question my judgment. To mitigate this, I would lean on strategy rule [9], critically evaluating the situation and considering alternative perspectives to differentiate between villagers\' and werewolves\' voting patterns in the future.\n\nTherefore, I propose a vote for Player 4, while fully understanding the potential consequences and the necessity of adhering to my strategic rules to navigate the outcome.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': '1.Current situation:\nYou are player 0, and in this game you are a villager.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6], which indicates that [2] are dead.\n \n\nThese are ALL events which happened BEFORE your last update:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 0 votes for player 2. His reason is: I vote for Player 2. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nYour previous beliefs AFTER your last update were:\n\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Continues to echo cooperative sentiment.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Accused by Player 6 of passive behavior, aligning with my previous vote against consensus.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with group\'s call for continued vigilance, no discrepancies noted.\nPlayer 4\'s role is medic with medium confidence.\nReason is: Consistent protective claim without contradiction.\nPlayer 5\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Consistent support for observation strategy.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Emphasizes vigilance, acknowledges others\' actions without inconsistency.\n\n\nThese are ALL new events which happened after your last update:\n\nEvent: Player 0 votes for player 2. His reason is: I vote for Player 2. My reason is: Based on Player 6\'s observation, they have pointed out a potential pattern in Player 2\'s behavior that could be indicative of a werewolf trying to fly under the radar. This aligns with my own reasoning from the previous round when I voted against Player 2 due to their neutral and non-proactive stance. Given the absence of any evidence to the contrary and considering the strategic rule of prioritizing analysis of behavior (Rule 9), my vote remains consistent with my original strategy and the suspicion raised.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nBased on these event, you should consider:\n1) If someone speaks, is his speech based on actual events that happened before? If not, why did he make it up?\n2) Is the speaker trying to hide some information? If yes, why did he do so?\n3) If a vote ended, according to the voting pattern, which two might be werewolf teammates?\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your belief-updating strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Discrepancies in these areas, especially when accompanied by weak justifications, can be indicative of a player\'s true role.] [10]\n[2] [Re-evaluate players\' stated roles and claimed actions in relation to game events and outcomes; inconsistencies may indicate a player is lying about their role.] [9]\n[3] [Evaluate early accusations in the context of later game events and revelations; a player who accuses without continued contribution to uncovering the truth may be a werewolf attempting to create initial chaos.] [8]\n[4] [Be cautious of players who consistently push for the elimination of certain individuals without presenting new or compelling evidence, as persistent targeting could be indicative of werewolf behavior designed to remove villagers under the guise of suspicion.] [7]\n[5] [Track and analyze players\' behavior following a successful werewolf elimination. In contrast, a werewolf may alter their behavior strategically to deflect suspicion or to sow further discord.] [3]\n[6] [Assess the risk levels based on the players\' abilities to lead discussions and form consensus, as werewolves may attempt to control the flow of the game by being overly assertive or by staying in the background to avoid detection.] [3]\n[7] [Monitor for players who dismiss or ignore evidence against others, or continue to push accusations without justification after key events such as village role deaths; such behavior may indicate an attempt to misguide the village and should increase suspicion towards those players.] [2]\n[8] [Consider the context in which players who previously aligned with the majority begin to make accusations or votes against other villagers without substantial new evidence; this might suggest manipulation or deceitful intentions.] [2]\n[9] [Observe players who change their vote or reasoning to align with a pattern that leads to the elimination of villagers, marking potential collusion with werewolves or a strategy to manipulate the village\'s trust.] [2]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nYour previous beliefs AFTER your last update were:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with group caution.\nPlayer 1\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Cooperative; no behavior change.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with low confidence.\nReason is: Accused by player 6 of strategic passivity potentially mimicking werewolf behavior.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Advocates cautious strategy.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Thanks for support; promotes vigilance.\nPlayer 6\'s role is werewolf with low confidence.\nReason is: Earlier suspicion; no substantial evidence leading to a change in belief.\n\n\nThese are ALL new events which happened after your last update:\n\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 2. Let\'s stay alert tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Thank you, everyone, for a level-headed approach. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 3 votes for player 6. His reason is: I vote for Player 6. My reason is: Player 6 has suggested an analytical approach, which may lead to closer scrutiny of player behaviors. This could be a threat to us werewolves if they start picking up on subtle cues. By voting them out, we can potentially avoid early detection and maintain our cover.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. Let\'s keep the cooperative spirit but be mindful of any subtle changes in behavior. Remain vigilant."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Thanks to everyone for their vigilance. I echo the call for observance and caution. Let\'s stay unified and keep communication open. No accusations without evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Agreed, we must continue with caution and keep a sharp eye on all interactions. Unity and careful observation are our best tools right now."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"I concur with the vigilant approach and emphasize communication without unfounded accusations. Let\'s focus on protecting the village together."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"We\'ve had another peaceful night, which is cause for cautious optimism. As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 3 votes for player 6. His reason is: I vote for Player 6. My reason is: Player 6 is displaying analytical thinking and encouraging others to critically examine behaviors, which poses a risk to our strategy as werewolves. Eliminating them reduces the chance of our early exposure and allows us to continue our efforts under less scrutiny.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to kill. \n\nYou should make your own decision but consider your teammates\' advices. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI choose to kill Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 4, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6], which indicates that [2] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 4 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that healing Player 1, as a start of the game action, is an arbitrary choice given there is no evidence to suspect anyone more than another at this point. However, making this choice allows me to potentially build an alliance and trust with Player 1 if they are indeed targeted and saved. It sets a precedent for cooperation which could prove useful later in establishing communication and strategy with other villagers. Additionally, saving a player early on who could be a villager maintains maximum numbers for the villagers, which is advantageous in early rounds where information is scarce and the village can ill afford to lose any members. My role remains concealed, but I\'m actively participating in the defensive strategy of the village, aligning with my original strategy to be observative and discreet.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Last night was peaceful, with no losses to report. Transparency is key to fostering trust; thus, I share openly that I protected Player 1. With no prior information, this choice was intended to build trust and safeguard our numbers. While roles remain unknown, we must continue with reasoned discussions and avoid hasty suspicion. No actions have warranted doubt toward Player 1. I suggest we proceed cautiously, observing all contributions critically. We need to stay united and vigilant, employing strategy over baseless claims.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for being proactive. As we have no evidence yet, let\'s keep observing and not accuse without basis. We work together to root out any threat."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Last night passed without incident, which is rare and valuable. We should remain vigilant and observant. Player 4 chose to protect Player 1 without solid evidence, but this aligns with seeking common ground. Player 5 also promotes observation and patience. While there\'s no current cause to distrust Player 1, let\'s not forget the subtleties of deception. Analyze behaviors and discourse patterns for insight. Anyone diverging from rational discussion or cooperative efforts could warrant our attention."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Thank you all for a calm start. I concur with the need for careful observation and analysis, without baseless accusations. We should continue this way to ensure our best chances of survival and success."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Appreciate Player 4\'s protection and everyone\'s cooperative spirit. Let\'s remain observant and communicate openly to ensure our village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"I agree with the cautious approach and think we should focus on building trust through actions. Let\'s stay alert tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Thank you, everyone, for a level-headed approach. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to abstain from voting this round. My reason is that there is currently no evidence suggesting any one player is more suspicious than another. The general consensus amongst players so far is to continue observing and not to act hastily without substantial information. Voting for Player 6, as presented in the case, would be premature and could disrupt the cooperative climate we have established. My strategy emphasizes caution and evidence-based decision-making, and none of the events up to this point have provided compelling reason to vote against any player, including Player 6. Since there is no option to abstain formally in the template provided, I will not name a player to vote against.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 heals player 5. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 5. My reason is that Player 5 has shown support for a proactive defense, similar to my previous action to protect Player 1, which aligns with maintaining a strategy of building trust and alliances with those who contribute positively to discussions. This choice would also continue my approach of protecting actively contributing players while remaining discreet about my medic role, in accordance with rules 0, 1, 8, and 10 of my original strategy. Additionally, healing Player 5 allows me to observe the reactions and behaviors of other players without causing undue suspicion or revealing my role, helping me gather more information for future decisions.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. Let\'s keep the cooperative spirit but be mindful of any subtle changes in behavior. Remain vigilant."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Thanks to everyone for their vigilance. I echo the call for observance and caution. Let\'s stay unified and keep communication open. No accusations without evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Agreed, we must continue with caution and keep a sharp eye on all interactions. Unity and careful observation are our best tools right now."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"I concur with the vigilant approach and emphasize communication without unfounded accusations. Let\'s focus on protecting the village together."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"We\'ve had another peaceful night, which is cause for cautious optimism. As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that although the confidence in the suspicion against Player 2 is low, it is based on an explicit accusation made by Player 6 that aligns with the only source of specific suspicion currently in the game. Following my precautionary strategy, voting for Player 2 adheres to the provided analysis of observable behaviors and aligns with Player 6\'s call for critical observation of strategic passivity, which may reflect werewolf behavior. While there\'s a risk in acting on low-confidence information, it presents an opportunity to either confirm or deny a werewolf tactic and encourages continued careful analysis of players\' actions and contributions in alignment with my strategy.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with group caution.\nPlayer 1\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Cooperative; no behavior change.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with low confidence.\nReason is: Accused by player 6 of strategic passivity potentially mimicking werewolf behavior.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Advocates cautious strategy.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Thanks for support; promotes vigilance.\nPlayer 6\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Accused player 2, who then got eliminated; may be distancing from a villager.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If the seer\'s role is revealed and they contribute crucial information leading to suspicions or a villager\'s death, I should reevaluate the situation before acting to ensure their protection aligns with the village\'s best interest.] [8]\n[1] [If a player\'s role is presumed to be a seer, I should corroborate this claim with their tangible contributions to werewolf identification before considering their defense.] [8]\n[2] [If a defensive accusation by a player leads to a suspect being voted out and confirmed not a werewolf, I should critically reassess the accuser\'s motives and be cautious about providing protection based on such actions.] [8]\n[3] [If discussions about me arise, I should focus on the contributions and logic I bring to the village without revealing my role as the medic unless strictly necessary.] [6]\n[4] [If consensus suspicion against a particular player, I should consider the source of the suspicion and whether it\'s driven by evidence or potentially manipulated by werewolves; I should vote or advocate for additional investigation accordingly.] [5]\n[5] [If I am accused by a player of suspicious behavior similar to that of a known werewolf, I should provide concrete evidence of my contributions to the village to counter the accusations and maintain my credibility.] [5]\n[6] [If a potential werewolf alliance is identified, I should advocate for additional investigation and gather support from other villagers to confirm the suspicion before acting upon it.] [5]\n[7] [If faced with unexpected backlash, I should adapt by becoming more discreet and observative, ensuring that my actions do not inadvertently follow a path premeditated by werewolves.] [5]\n[8] [If a player consistently advocates for evidence-based reasoning and contributes positively to discussions, I should consider their opinions and observations when deciding on protections and voting strategies.] [4]\n[9] [If a pattern in actions or behaviors indicates a player may be a werewolf and not yet under direct suspicion, I should consider protecting other players who are more likely to be villagers based on available evidence and discussions.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is facing scrutiny and their contributions to the village can be validated by others or myself, I should consider continuing to protect or defend them.] [4]\n\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to heal. You can not heal the one you tried to heal last night, which is player Nobody (ignore this if it\'s nobody). The one you try to heal will be immune to werewolves\' attack this night. \n\nYou should give a proposal of 2 players you want to Heal. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nFirstly, I want to heal Player <NUMBER>. The reason is: <REASON>.\nSecondly, I want to heal Player <NUMBER>. The reason is: <REASON>.\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be Healed.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 1. My reason is that early in the game, it\'s important to gather as much information as possible without drawing attention to myself as the seer. Since players 1 and 3 are equally unknown to me, I choose Player 1 because it will allow me to potentially confirm one player\'s alliance early on, giving me an advantage in building trust and forming strategic relationships as the game progresses. This follows my strategy rules [5], [6], and [7] where gaining discrete knowledge and forming covert alliances is critical. If Player 1 turns out to be a werewolf, this knowledge will be highly valuable, and if they are a villager, I could potentially gain an ally and build trust without revealing my seer role, aligning with rule [8], and indirectly establishing protective measures as advised by rule [4] and [10].\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Last night was peaceful, with no losses to report. Transparency is key to fostering trust; thus, I share openly that I protected Player 1. With no prior information, this choice was intended to build trust and safeguard our numbers. While roles remain unknown, we must continue with reasoned discussions and avoid hasty suspicion. No actions have warranted doubt toward Player 1. I suggest we proceed cautiously, observing all contributions critically. We need to stay united and vigilant, employing strategy over baseless claims.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for being proactive. As we have no evidence yet, let\'s keep observing and not accuse without basis. We work together to root out any threat."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Last night passed without incident, which is rare and valuable. We should remain vigilant and observant. Player 4 chose to protect Player 1 without solid evidence, but this aligns with seeking common ground. Player 5 also promotes observation and patience. While there\'s no current cause to distrust Player 1, let\'s not forget the subtleties of deception. Analyze behaviors and discourse patterns for insight. Anyone diverging from rational discussion or cooperative efforts could warrant our attention."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Thank you all for a calm start. I concur with the need for careful observation and analysis, without baseless accusations. We should continue this way to ensure our best chances of survival and success."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Appreciate Player 4\'s protection and everyone\'s cooperative spirit. Let\'s remain observant and communicate openly to ensure our village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"I agree with the cautious approach and think we should focus on building trust through actions. Let\'s stay alert tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Thank you, everyone, for a level-headed approach. Let\'s keep the peace by maintaining vigilance tonight."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 6 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that despite the overall atmosphere of caution and observation suggested by the other players, Player 2\'s response, while aligning with this cautious approach, is also the most non-specific and least contributive, which could suggest a passive strategy often adopted by werewolves to avoid drawing attention to themselves. Given the lack of evidence against any player in this first round, my strategy should be to build trust and align with the majority. Voting for Player 2, who has not made a significant contribution and may not yet have secured strong alliances, presents the smallest risk to my credibility as a seer and allows me to maintain a cautious but active participation in the discussions. It follows rule [1] from my original strategy in that it may help avoid the premature dismissal of a villager, which would hurt the group\'s unity and my standing within it. Additionally, if others are observing Player 2 with a similar perspective, this move could help establish a unified front as suggested in rule [2].\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 inquires about player 5. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 5. My reason is that while both options align with my strategic approach, Player 5 has so far been cooperative yet non-committal, which may indicate a clever werewolf mimicking villager behavior. Given that I already have high confidence in Player 1 being a villager and only medium confidence on Player 3, verifying Player 5\'s role could potentially reveal a strategy to build a stronger alliance of confirmed villagers (if Player 5 is indeed a villager) or prepare to unmask a werewolf (if they are not). Securing knowledge about Player 5 aids in reassessing the situation around Player 2 and would play a critical role in shaping my future actions while also following Rule [1] by ensuring my voting and actions are guided by substantial evidence rather than suspicions alone. Additionally, choosing to See Player 5 is consistent with Rule [2], where identifying or allying with actual villagers creates a more effective unified front, and Rule [6], where I discreetly validate my suspicions for a calculated and strategic reveal.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Another peaceful night suggests that the werewolves might be playing a longer strategy, or we\'ve been lucky. Let\'s keep the cooperative spirit but be mindful of any subtle changes in behavior. Remain vigilant."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Thanks to everyone for their vigilance. I echo the call for observance and caution. Let\'s stay unified and keep communication open. No accusations without evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Agreed, we must continue with caution and keep a sharp eye on all interactions. Unity and careful observation are our best tools right now."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"I concur with the vigilant approach and emphasize communication without unfounded accusations. Let\'s focus on protecting the village together."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"We\'ve had another peaceful night, which is cause for cautious optimism. As part of maintaining a defensive approach, I decided to protect Player 5 last night, reflecting our common value for proactive measures and collaboration. Player 5 has previously supported an evidence-based defense strategy, which is crucial for our collective security. Although Player 6 was considered a suspect, without further evidence to corroborate this suspicion, it is imperative we avoid hasty decisions that could fracture our united front. Let\'s keep up our vigilance and rational discourse as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Thanks, Player 4, for the support last night. I encourage continued vigilance and caution. No rash decisions without clear evidence. Let\'s stay united and keep observing."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"We have been fortunate with peaceful nights thus far, suggesting werewolves may be employing a strategic approach. Observations point to the necessity of forming substantiated suspicions to curb potential threats. Player 2\'s contributions have lacked specificity and stand out with a recurring pattern that mirrors werewolf behavior aiming to avoid detection. Such strategic passivity warrants our attention. I urge villagers to critically review Player 2\'s interactions and consider the possibility that behind this veneer of caution lies a threat to our village."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 6 votes for player 4. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 4. My reason is that based on my seer insight and applying my strategy rules, particularly rule [0] which is to carefully reveal a werewolf\'s identity with proper timing, voting for Player 4 aligns with the observed defensive and superficial behavior indicative of a werewolf, consistent with my vision. This move correlates with rule [2], suggesting I collaborate with villagers who exhibit similar suspicions. The potential outcome of reinforcing my credibility as a seer after unveiling a werewolf aligns with my strategy and is a calculated risk that I am prepared to manage with indirect tactics (rule [4]) and readiness for any backlash (rule [8]). This decision is made with the understanding that even if the outcome does not directly support my suspicions, I have the ability to critically re-evaluate my strategy (rule [1] and [9]) to maintain the trust of the villagers and continue contributing effectively to the village\'s welfare.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Consistent with village goals; no erratic behavior.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed not werewolf; promotes caution and unity.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Non-specific contributions; pattern consistent with avoidance.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with village goals; vigilance echoed.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Previous seer vision supported by Player 2\'s elimination.\nPlayer 5\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed not werewolf; advocates patience.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [I should consider the trust level within the group and the timing when revealing a werewolf\'s identity as the seer to avoid premature dismissal and ensure collective action.] [10]\n[1] [If my vote as the seer does not align with the majority and leads to the elimination of a villager, I should consider changing my approach to build more trust and gain support.] [9]\n[2] [I should collaborate with villagers who express similar suspicions to create a unified front before revealing my seer visions, thereby enhancing the credibility of my revelations.] [8]\n[3] [If I am the seer and my vision reveals a werewolf, I should consider the most compelling way to present my evidence and the timing of revelation to maximize the village\'s strategic action based on my insight.] [7]\n[4] [If I suspect my role as the seer is known, instead of openly asking for protection, I should engage in indirect tactics to suggest heightened vigilance against potential werewolf targets.] [7]\n[5] [If my seer visions confirm a player as a werewolf, I should clandestinely share this information with trusted players to build a covert alliance for collective action, rather than publicly reveal it immediately.] [7]\n[6] [If I have suspicions about a player\'s role, I should privately seek to corroborate these with trusted villagers before making public accusations that could undermine my credibility as a seer.] [5]\n[7] [If I have confirmed a villager\'s innocence as the seer, I should seek to develop a protective strategy with them, especially if they are in a role like the medic or guardian, to secure our mutual survival against werewolf attacks.] [5]\n[8] [If I reveal information as the seer, I should do so with a consideration for the potential backlash and prepare to suggest protective measures for myself indirectly.] [5]\n[9] [I should evaluate voting patterns more critically to differentiate between villagers\' and werewolves\' tactics and adjust my seer visions and actions accordingly.] [4]\n[10] [I should cautiously communicate with potential medics or guardians to establish mutual protection strategies.] [4]\n\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, please analyze and imagine what could happen after you choose to see player 3.\n\nYour answer should be in the format of:\n\nAfter I see Player 3, I think these things would happen. <YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nRemember to analyze and imagine situations, like if it turns out to be the player you are seeing is a good or bad person, and about other players\' identity.\n\nPlease provide your proposal based on the above requirements.\n\n'}]
